scripts.say: East Méditerranée - International Canal
To think that there was a time when one could not access the Méditerranée through this canal...
Mm, it’s a bit of a miracle isn’t it? A supposedly neutral canal where anyone can pass through, regardless of their alliances.
What’s so unusual about that? Yukikaze the Great goes wherever she pleases anyway.
The situation here is rather complicated. Despite most of the ocean being hotly contested between various factions, this incredibly important canal is largely free from such power struggles.
Of course, this Canal has changed hands many times as a result of these geopolitical disputes.
If matters were left in the hands of the Iron Blood, Sardegnia, and the Royal Navy, all-out war would’ve broken out.

With the Sirens’ appearance and the formation of the Azur Lane, the use and maintenance of this canal was converted into a public, international project. That has persisted even after the establishment of the Crimson Axis.
This canal arguably serves as a symbol of peace for humanity, and represents the joint front against the Sirens.
Of course, that makes it a rather unique case in this world. Once we pass this canal, though, I’m sure we’ll still see this conflict play out in full force.
So, what’s the state of the power struggle in the Méditerranée?
It’s a mess. Nominally, it’s under the control of the Vichya and the Iron Blood, but the Royal Navy has been expanding their influence.
Though Operation Siren has begun, the machinations of the leadership of the Azur Lane and the Crimson Axis ultimately will not change.
So that’s why you sent the 5th CarDiv the long way around...
(What... I thought that was just the usual course of crane bullying!)
Heh~ They’re our X-factor, so it’s only natural for them to arrive fashionably late. If we sailed our entire fleet through neutral waters, we’d be broadcasting our intentions to the whole world.
Besides, the Royal Navy’s leadership is going to be wary of us. Whatever they might have up their sleeves, we must have our own response.
Most importantly though, we’re in hostile waters. Draw too much attention to ourselves, and we might have to battle our way to Sardegna.
Akagi, are you truly in support of Operation Siren? After all, if the Eagle Union is going to be operating in the NA Ocean, the “Grey Ghost” won’t be...
An excellent question, Jintsuu.
I don’t mean to question your intentions, if you do not want to answer—
It’s not that complicated. The Sirens indeed are our common enemy, and the contents of the ceasefire agreement pose no detriment to the Sakura Empire.
We’ll continue our investigation of Siren technology while gathering information about the other factions.
But the most worthwhile prize of all... will be there as well.
Are you talking about the Commander?
...Ahem. There must be a deeper reason why the Sirens are suddenly retreating.
Bismarck and her cohorts did pass me a lot of valuable information, but... As you know, things are never quite as they seem when dealing with the Iron Blood.
Outsiders are outsiders after all. Nobody else will fight for the future of the Sakura Empire.
I shall reveal the secrets of this ocean with my own two hands~ Ahahaha...
